meanings.definition: Lying or occurring in one plane.
meanings.sent1: The uniplanar map showed all the locations on a single flat surface.
meanings.sent2: The artist's uniplanar drawing captured the simplicity of the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The uniplanar cake looked like a perfectly flat piece of art.
meanings.sent4: Her uniplanar thinking made it difficult for her to see different perspectives.
meanings.sent5: The uniplanar horizon stretched endlessly across the canvas.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to a single plane.
meanings.sent1: The uniplanar surface of the table made it easy to clean.
meanings.sent2: The uniplanar design of the building gave it a modern look.
meanings.sent3: The uniplanar road seemed to lead straight into the sky.
meanings.sent4: His uniplanar approach to problem-solving limited his creativity.
meanings.sent5: The uniplanar mirror reflected a perfect image back at her.

meanings.definition: Moving or capable of moving in one plane.
meanings.sent1: The uniplanar drone flew smoothly across the field.
meanings.sent2: The uniplanar robot could only move forwards and backwards.
meanings.sent3: The uniplanar fish swam in a straight line without turning.
meanings.sent4: Her uniplanar dance routine impressed the audience with its precision.
meanings.sent5: The uniplanar spaceship glided effortlessly through the atmosphere.
